• Document account using CSO activity codes

• Update/Maintain Vault Procedures
• Provide Daily Reporting to Leadership
• Complete Bi-weekly Side by Sides 
• Complete 2 QA's per Team Member Weekly
• All New Hire Training

• Maintain good standing at all time with Vivint Solar
• Will be able to accomplish teams workflow processes
• New Hire considered in "training" first 90 days
• Comprehend All Training Provided

• Maintain Good Standing with Vivint Solar
• Eligible to QA Workflow Processes completed by Teammates
• Begin Training on Inbox Processes & Communications

• Maintain Good Standing with Vivint Solar
• Able to complete one or more processes from another team

• Training on Customer Communication & Phone Calls

• Maintain Good Standing with Vivint Solar
• Able to Complete all Inbox Processes
• Begin training on one or more special projects (such as Requested Items)
• Begin training on one or more processes from another team

• Maintain Good Standing with Vivint Solar
• Begin Training on Escalated Accounts & Moving them Forward

• Begin Training on Customer & Program Communication
• Able to Complete two or more processes form another team
• Training on Salesforce Reporting
• Able to Complete Customer Communication & Phone Calls
• Processing Specialist II is considered "Acting Team Lead"

• Maintain Good Standing with Vivint Solar
• Handles Escalated Accounts
• Maintain Workflow & Volume for the Team
• Conduct ALL New Hire & UP Training for the Team
• Handles Special Projects (Such as Requested Items)
• Able to build and run Salesforce Reports for Team
• Build Relationships with Counter Departments
• Conduct Weekly Coaching for Team Members
• Monthly Leadership Training

• Scheduling Installations for reps, techs, and customers
• Rescheduling Site Surveys
• Ability to respond and complete installation email requests
• Proficient with Click software
• Knowledgeable of case and hold procedures
• Knowledgeable of the installation process including how to read and use headers

• Competent in completing all various types of emails received through the general RTS inbox
• Competent in AB2FIN Scheduling and able to assist with AB2FIN Scheduling calls
• Assists with training by y-jacking with new employees and is able to competently walk an new hire through the installation schedule process

• Proficient with the Arrival Window Procedure and perfect adherence to zero arrival window breaks
• Competent in SREC Scheduling and able to assist with SREC Scheduling calls
• Competent in Removal and Reinstall Scheduling and able to assist with Removal and Reinstall Scheduling calls

• 50% of time is dedicated to handling inbound calls and emails
• 50%  of time is dedicated to floor support and monitoring phone queues
• Monitors and assigns work within the RTS Inbox
• Owns and manages a report/project
• Owns new hire training
• Assists in uptraining
• Responsible for handling 2nd level escalations
• Knowledgeable of all RT'S processes and practices
• Ability to provide feedback to agents and performs side by sides
• Advanced Knowledge of Central scheduling and maximizing processes and efficiency

• Manage two QA techs by ensuring their calendar is filled with QA appts every week
• Competent in AB2FIN Scheduling and procedures
• Proficient with the Arrival Window Procedure and perfect adherance to zero arrival window breaks
• Proficient at creating scheduling cases for pre-PTO service work
•  Competent in Notary scheduling procedures

• Proficient with derate scheduling procedures for pre-PTO accounts
• Establishes strong professional relationships with utility companies
• 50% of time is dedicated to inbound call assistance
• AB2FIN, Pre-PTO Scheduling, QA, Notary

• 40% of time is dedicated to floor support and monitoring phone queues
• 40% of time is dedicated to Auxiliary agent duties (manage two QA Offices)
• 20% of time is dedicated to Wiki Support and Communications
• Edit and publish department processes within the Vault
• Sustain 100% NP Score with QA Techs
• Monitor AB2FIN RTS bucket
• Establish strong relationships with QA field managers and techs
• Drive property survey requests to completion
• Responsible for handling 2nd level escalations
• Advanced Knowledge of Central scheduling and maximizing processes and efficiency
• Ability to provide feedback to agents and performs side by sides
• Responsible for ensuring all of RTS is communicated new polices, procedures, shout-outs and other necessary department communications

• Performing Defcons/Backfilling/Office optimization
• Communicates daily with their assigned OM to ensure calendar optimization and good field relations
• Auditing 100% of accounts within assigned Region

• Region Lead - A Super Agent who ensures all offices have audits completed and installs filled within a specific region with two other agents
• Maintain Good Standing with Vivint Solar
• Proficient in scheduling preferences for all offices in the region
• Gives back-up assistance as needed to other regional agents
• Reports and coordinates necessary up training needs of individual agents with Supervisor and TL for their region

• Proficient in scheduling Installations for Reps,Techs and Customers
• Completing Daily Regional Install Confirmation Dialer Tasks
• Assist in completing daily Permit approved list- Dialer Tasks
• Provides overflow support for inbound calls
• Maintains communication throughout each day with OM

• 75% of assigned offices Install Calendar Filled
• Competent to schedule service appointments per OM request
• Coordinates with DM over their region to help fill the install calendar

• Competent in scheduling removals and re-installs with customers
• Audit existing removals or re-installs on the calendar
• Knowledgeable of the removal and reinstall process including how to read headers
• Competent in responding and completing service now requests

• Proficient with the Arrival Window Procedure and perfect adherence to zero arrival window breaks
• Manages 40 cases per day

• Proficient understanding of the Removal and Reinstall scheduling procedures
• Able to read and understand SREC cases and schedule correctly
• Competent to assign priority tickets
• Manages 30 cases per day

• 24hr priority ticket closure time
• Establishes strong professional relationships with SPMs
• Knowledgeable of the end to end Removal and Reinstall Process

• 50% of time is dedicated to super agent responsibilities
• 50%  of time is dedicated to floor support and monitoring phone queues
• Assists with department on trainings on changes within the Services process
• Responsible for handling 2nd level escalations
• Point of contact for SPM's - maintains good relationhips with all SPMs
• Ability to provide feedback to agents and performs side by sides
• Advanced Knowledge of Central scheduling and maximizing processes and efficiency
• Meter Swap cases
• Builds relationships with other departments to eliminate silos and promote trust.

• Assist with Post-PTO Troubleshooting and general questions.
• Able to navigate SalesForce to answer customer questions.
• Basic knowledge of ServiceNow and Email Procedures.
• Knowledgeable about the Corporate Review process.
• Answer incoming calls from customers

• Basic understanding of the Install to PTO process, know which department owns each step, and accurately respond to customer inquiries about their system.

• Intermediate understanding of the Install to PTO process, know which department owns each step, and accurately respond to customer inquiries about their system.
• Audit accounts for errors that will affect progress.
• Intermediate knowledge of VSLR Products, Contracts, and Utility/Rebate documents.
• Able to efficiently navigate SalesForce to research an account and answer customer questions.
• Make outbound calls to customers

• Work with the training team to develop up training for all agents.
• Advanced communication skills, both written and verbal.
• Take live calls from escalated customers when another agents is unable to de-escalate.
